Rulings.Tengu:
●While the effect of Timidity is active, all effects of a card which would destroy a Set Spell or Trap Card are negated.
●While the effect of Timidity is active, you cannot destroy a face-down Monster Card equipped to Relinquished.
●While the effect of Timidity is active, and your opponent activates Heavy Storm, face-down Spell and Trap Cards are not destroyed but face-up cards will be.
Rulings.Goat:
●While the effect of Timidity is applying, all effects of a card which would destroy a Set Spell/Trap Card are negated.
●While the effect of Timidity is applying, you cannot destroy a face-down Monster Card equipped to Relinquished.
●While the effect of Timidity is applying, and your opponent activates Heavy Storm, face-down Spell/Trap Cards are not destroyed but face-up cards will be.Steve Okegawa, 
●Q: Does the effect of Timidity end at the beginning of the opponent's End Phase, or the end of the opponent's End Phase? 
A: Timidity will no longer be in effect when you reach the opponent's next End Phase. So in my turn I activate Timidity. It resolves properly. I Set 1 card in my S/T Zone. I end my turn. My opponent's turn begins. Until their End Phase, any Set Spell/Trap Cards cannot be destroyed. During my opponent's End Phase they could activate a Mystical Space Typhoon and target my face-down card in my Spell/Trap Card Zone, and it could be destroyed.

Rulings.Base: 1. While the effect of "Timidity" is active, all effects of a card which would destroy a Set Spell or Trap Card are negated.\n2. While the effect of "Timidity" is active, you cannot destroy a face-down Monster Card equipped to "Relinquished".\n3. While the effect of "Timidity" is active, and your opponent activates "Heavy Storm", face-down Spell and Trap Cards are not destroyed but face-up cards will be.
